title: [ERROR] dataset containing given paths is not underneath the reference dataset
body:
Not a bug, just something to report.

#### What is the problem?
Following the approach suggested by @yarikoptic [here](https://neurostars.org/t/datalad-containers-data-organization-multiple-questions/5509) I install a raw bids dataset inside the folder that will contain some processed data. Then I do `container-run`, which all works. But there is an error printed on the terminal, which does not cause a failure. Maybe it should be just a notification rather than error?  
```
[INFO] Making sure inputs are available (this may take some time)
[ERROR] dataset containing given paths is not underneath the reference dataset <Dataset path=/DATA/dorian/dataladtest/FEDERATED_DATASETS/STUDY1/data/processed/mriqc>: [PosixPath('/DATA/dorian/dataladtest/FEDERATED_DATASETS/STUDY1/data/processed/mriqc')] [status(/DATA/dorian/dataladtest/FEDERATED_DATASETS/STUDY1/data/processed)]
[INFO] == Command start (output follows) =====
```
This is the command that was used to get the above output:
```
datalad containers-run  --explicit \
        -n containers/bids-mriqc \
        --input 'bids/' \
        --output './' -- \
        '{inputs}' '{outputs}' \
        --no-sub \
        --nprocs 30 \
        --verbose-reports \
        participant 
```


#### What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Create the nested structure DATASET_A/DATASET_B.
2. Go in DATASET_A and perform a `run` command (or container run) using the subdataset DATASET_B as input. 

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?
o.12.0rc6

#### Is there anything else that would be useful to know in this context?
No

#### Have you had any success using DataLad before? (to assess your expertise/prior luck.  We would welcome your testimonial additions to https://github.com/datalad/datalad/wiki/Testimonials as well)
NA
